title: Variadic functions
question: Which of these are true about variadic functions?
hint: Variadic parameters behave much like regular ones, except they are converted to an array inside the function.
correct: A variadic parameter is written with three dots after its name: Int...
Variadic parameters can potentially receive hundreds of values.
Variadic parameters can potentially receive zero values.
Variadic parameters are converted into arrays inside your function.
You can write your own variadic functions.
wrong: Variadic functions only work with integers.
Variadic parameters must always have at least one value.
Variadic functions are slower than regular functions.
You can pass an array in place of a variadic parameter.
Variadic functions must always return a value.
Variadic functions must always omit external parameter labels.
